CatDescriptText: Barry Williams, student, Mt. Lebanon and Don Denkhas, student, Mt. Lebanon, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, December 3, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that integration in all schools in the South should be effected immediately, or do you favor permitting a reasonable length of time?  If so, how long a period do you consider as a "reasonable length of time?"  Mr. Williams's answer reads: "They should be given a little bit of time to think things over...I have no idea just how long this should take, but it should be no more than a couple of weeks."  Mr. Denkhas' answer reads: "They should wait about one year, and then let the people vote on it and see what they think about integration and whether they should have integration or not."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Barry Williams wearing striped shirt, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Don Denkhas wearing geometric patterned shirt, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
